data.title: Deborah Meaden on LinkedIn: This is how I start my day when we are filming Dragons Den… and I can’t…
data.meta_description: This is how I start my day when we are filming Dragons Den… and I can’t tell you how brilliant it is to be back In Manchester with my fellow Dragons. Two days… | 49 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
Are you an entrepreneur struggling to scale your business? Do you feel stuck, frustrated, and afraid you'll never reach your goals? I've been there. I know the sleepless nights worrying about cash flow. The overwhelming feeling of having too many tasks and not enough time. The nagging doubt about whether you really have what it takes. But I discovered a method that changed everything. A method that took me from struggle to success, from stress to freedom. If you want to learn: - How to package your startup to attract investors - How to find and approach the right investors - How to create a compelling pitch ...even if you've never raised capital before and time is running out. Comment '🚀' below and I'll share some game-changing strategies that can help you finally build the business you dream of, attract the right team members, and live the life you deserve.

Advice for early-stage founders: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together. Why am I saying this? Because investors see this as a red flag when on the team slide in a pitch deck they see only one. I get it that at the beginning of every venture, you have to be a generalist who knows a bit about everything. But if you want to raise, scale, and grow the business you need a team of experts around you. So don’t walk the lone wolf road while pursuing the investment route. PS: We just launched a free pitch deck guide. It’s meant for entrepreneurs looking for help with building a pitch deck. You can get it on my profile!

Fun facts: On average, it takes between seven and ten years from founding for a startup to reach an IPO or exit. Longer if you include being hit by a global pandemic. To all of the inspiring entrepreneurs, investors and founders out there check out these eight exit strategies you should consider. Some companies will see revenue and profit early, others it could take years before seeing a profit. Some investors for the long term opportunity and others investor for the short term upside either way investing and creating a new company is risky and challenging. When cresting your business plan and or investment deck always have a exit strategy in mind and be willing and ready to pivot your idea or strategy just Incase unforeseen circumstances occur. Join our entrepreneur program today for help and more information. Link in Bio or text 323-873-6061

Begin your Dream Exit™ Planning and Create the Future You Want to Own I'm inspired by the conversations I have with successful, forward-thinking business owners & entrepreneurs about the companies they've created and the tricky challenge around building their companies, while also building exponential freedom and meaning in their lives - with or without their business. No one has a permanent lease on life - although it can be hard to accept or acknowledge that. Not because it's intellectually hard [it isn't], but because it can be emotionally defeating [and we're not quitters, right?] We like to live in the moment, in the present. Let's face it, that's the only time we can be in, really. But while we can't live in the future, we can certainly do a lot in the present to give us the best chance or creating and making real what we want to have happen in the future. I like to think of our future as our rapidly approaching present. I know that business owners have a responsibility to create what I call "Dream Exits" for themselves. Exercising that responsibility will always lead to a company that is more valuable and to a better business owner - personally and professionally. Simply put, it leads to the creation of maximum value for the business and maximum meaning for the entrepreneur. It's a process that is unfortunately often overlooked, a can that is too easily kicked down the road. Why? Because hardly anyone holds the owner accountable to their responsibilities the way that owners like to hold other people accountable - so there's sort of a double standard at play. There isn't a good reason to play that game - not with the most valuable and important personal and professional asset you own. So why not start today - with this present moment - to begin your Dream Exit™ Planning and Create the Future You Want to Own. Take the first step and connect with me. I'd like to learn more about you & your future dream exit. Let's talk. mike@dreamexit.com #dreamexit #exitplanning #yourfutureisyourproperty #stopkickingthecandowntheroad #takethefirststep

Risk versus intuition: the entrepreneur's tightrope. Imagine slicing off the profitable arm of your business on just a hunch. Sounds like a recipe for disaster, right? That's precisely what we did in one of my early ventures. Against a backdrop of skepticism from employees and shareholders alike, we moved to phase out the only profitable unit to pave the way for a new product. Yes, it was an educated gamble that gave us countless sleepless nights. But here's the twist—it worked. This decision wasn't made lightly. It was a blend of calculated risk and gut feeling, a testament to the entrepreneurial spirit of venturing into the unknown with nothing but a belief in one's vision. Have you ever taken a leap of faith in your business, steering away from the safe harbor in pursuit of uncharted territories, successful or otherwise? I would love to hear your story and connect.

Here’s an undeniable truth about entrepreneurship: 🚀 The progress of your venture hinges directly on your personal development. 🚀 The landscape remains unchanged until you do. 🚀 To excel as an entrepreneur, you must initially excel as an individual. 🚀 You need to be resilient, confronting challenges directly and prioritizing solutions over setbacks. 🚀 You need discipline, showing up every day with a commitment to surpassing your previous self. 🚀 Transparency is key, ensuring that your actions both in and out of the boardroom are guided by unwavering integrity. 🚀 And collaboration is essential, valuing your team, partners, and customers, and prioritizing collective success over individual accomplishments. 🚀 Nurturing these attributes is crucial for those aspiring to leave a mark in the entrepreneurial realm. 🚀 Yet, recognizing this is much easier than putting it into practice. It requires facing your toughest adversary: yourself. Once you identify the areas where you need to grow, you must consistently tread the path, day in and day out.

There's nothing more frustrating as an entrepreneur than having a million-dollar #idea but no guidance on #how to raise the capital to get that idea off the ground. In any case, we all can't get a gig on Shark Tank, pitch our idea to the sharks, get berated by Mr. Wonderful for 30 minutes, #only for him to completely ignore our asks, and offer us a terrible deal and 10 seconds to decide. Pitching ideas off-camera can be just as tricky. In this article, I will refrain from sharing my thoughts on Mr Wonderful's behavior momentarily and instead provide you with all the information you need to develop a million-dollar pitch deck for potential investors

🦈 You ever watch Shark Tank or Dragons Den? 😓 Founders coming in for 100-300k giving up Equity of their business?? 🤝 I believe the real benefit is having a Billionaire as a business partner, I’ll take the partnership any day just because you’d be around a billionaire, that’s where the real value is. 🤦🏻♂️ However, imagine how many business owners give up equity in their business for the same $100,000 I’ve worked with 7 and 8-digit figure Entrepreneurs who are making money but have no idea how to leverage credit to their advantage. 🙅🏻♂️ I’ve seen people run $90,000 monthly on Facebook ads on their personal side, not because their business is not doing well, but because they don’t know any better. By no means do I think Debt is good. 🤷♂️ But what happens to the start-up entrepreneur that needs a little bit of money to get started, for materials, hiring, for product? 💰 The capital needs to come from somewhere. 🏦 The money is out there, and it’s a matter of finding it. Fortunately, all you need in the US is good credit in order to get Capital. If you are an entrepreneur seeking capital, especially 150k @ 0%. Comment “ SHARK” to see if you are a good fit.
